meanings.definition: A person who travels and lives in a semi-nomadic manner, often relying on temporary shelter and odd jobs for income.
meanings.sent1: The semihoboes set up camp near the river.
meanings.sent2: Many semihoboes travel from town to town looking for work.
meanings.sent3: The semihoboes found humor in their makeshift tent collapsing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The group of semihoboes were like modern-day nomads, carrying their homes on their backs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the semihoboes cooking over a campfire stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: To live a transient lifestyle, moving from place to place without a permanent home.
meanings.sent1: They semihoboes through the countryside, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent2: She semihoboes around the country, exploring new cities and towns.
meanings.sent3: The couple decided to semihoboes for a year to experience different cultures.
meanings.sent4: His mind semihoboes from one idea to the next, never settling on a single thought.
meanings.sent5: The river semihoboes through the valley, carving its path over time.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being semi-homeless or living in a semi-nomadic manner.
meanings.sent1: The semihoboes faced challenges finding stable housing.
meanings.sent2: In times of economic hardship, many people experience semihoboes.
meanings.sent3: The concept of semihoboes became a topic of discussion among urban planners.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt a sense of semihoboes, torn between two different worlds.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of semihoboes, depicting a person on the move.
